description: Redevelopment of open land (Part of Rectory Park) to north of Ruislip Road, to include the construction of 12 artificial surface pitches (11 x 5 a side, 1 x 7 a side) with floodlighting and fencing, erection of 2 storey replacement pavilion to provide changing rooms, gym, ancillary lounge bar, caf  and cr che and formation of new vehicular access from Ruislip Road, associated car parking and servicing, landscaping and provision of a 3.5 metre close boarded acoustic fence along eastern boundary of artificial surface pitches
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings (4.1, B1). | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. (4.1, B1). | The existing trees on the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:  To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area (4.5, B2, B16). | The authorised tree removal/pruning and crown reduction shall be carried out to the latest requirement of British Standard 3998 "Recommendations for Tree Work."  REASON:  To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area (4.5, B2, B16). | The entire root system of trees to be retained, as shown on the approved drawings, indicated by the spread of their branches, shall be protected by stout exclusion fencing until completion of the development.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5, B2, B16). | The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained as shown on the approved drawings shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5, B2, B16). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5, B2). | Details of floodlighting for the eleven five a side and one seven a side pitches shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is approved is first brought into use.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area (4.12, ES5). | Details of External Lighting, (other than floodlighting for the pitches), to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9 must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of the site and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area (4.12, ES5). | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists (9.12, T15, T46). | Before the building works hereby approved commence, the vehicular access to the site from Ruislip Road shall be constructed and in use.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety (9.1, T23). | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan Drawing No. 3184-01B shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON:  To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site (9.1, 9.12, T15, T40, T41, T44, T45, T46, T56, T62 and T63.). | The building and associated hardstanding hereby approved shall not be occupied until the existing sports pavilion, its related hardstanding area, and all associated debris has been removed.  REASON: In the interest of visual amenity (4.1, B1). | The use of the hard surfaced pitches shall not operate outside the hours of 0900hrs to 2200hrs on any day.  REASON:  In the interest of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties (8.1, 8.2, CF2, CF4). | The use of the pavilion shall not operate outside the hours of 0900 to 2300 hours Sunday to Thursday and 0900 to 2400 hours Friday to Saturday.  REASON:  In the interest of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties (8.1, 8.2, CF2, CF4).  The reason for this alteration is that the original condition implied that the premises would have to close at 12 Midday on Fridays and Saturdays.  It is considered that this alteration adds further clarification.  In addition, should members support the recommendation to grant planning permission I suggest that Condition 27 should also be attached. | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Planning Authority.  REASON:  In the interest of archaeological heritage (4.9, B28, B29). | Notwithstanding information contained in the application details of sound attenuation measures in respect of the eastern boundary shall be submitted to and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority, prior to the commencement of any work on site.  Such details as approved must be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to any part of the development being brought into use.  REASON:  In the interest of the amenity of neighbouring occupiers (4.1, B1). | No more than 2,400 sq. metres of gross internal floor space shall be provided within the pavilion building.  REASON:  To accord with the terms of the submitted application and in the interests of sufficient parking and servicing provision and the safety and free flow of both pedestrian and vehicular traffic and to ensure that the building and use is of a scale compatible with its Green Belt location (4.1, B1). | No more than 98 car parking spaces (+96 overflow spaces)(of which 5 spaces shall be for disabled users) shall be provided across the entire development hereby approved.  REASON:  To ensure that the parking provision is in accordance with the Council policies in the interest of the free flow and safety of traffic in the vicinity (9.1, 9.12, T15, T40, T41, T44, T45, T46, T56, T62, T63. | Any LAMAX level of noise events clearly identified to originate from activities relating to the proposed site should not exceed 10 Db (A) above the prevailing background noise level (measured in LA90, 1 hour), measured at a distance of 3.5m on the ground floor and 1m on upper floors from the nearest affected dwelling fatade (0700 to 2300 hrs) in Byron Way, Highview and Rectory Park Avenue.  REASON:  To ensure that the amenities of neighbouring occupiers are not unduly affected (4.1, 4.11, B1, B8, ES5). | The noise generated as a result of the proposed use (the ambient noise with the site facilities in operation, including from any music, tannoys, etc.) should not cause any increase in the initial ambient noise level (UDP policy ES5) or in the residual noise level that prevails at any time after the proposed facility is in operation, measured in LAEQ (1 hour) at a distance of 3.5m on the ground floor and 1m on upper floors from the nearest affected dwelling fatade (0700 to 2300 hrs) Byron Way, Highview and Rectory Park Avenue.  REASON:  To ensure that the amenities of neighbouring occupiers are not unduly affected (4.1, 4.11, B1, B8, ES5). | The floodlights shall not be operated during the period 10pm to fall of dark on the following day, on any day.  REASON:  In the interest of the amenity of neighbouring occupiers (4.12, ES5). | Surface water source control measures shall be carried out in accordance with details, which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development commences.    REASON:  To prevent the increased risk of flooding and to improve water quality (2.5, R10). | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, details of access to the pavilion and disabled car parking in accordance with the Council's Policies as set out in Revised UDP Policies shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any work on site.  Such details as are approved shall be implemented before first occupation and thereafter retained.  REASON:  To ensure that the proposed development is in accordance with Accessible Ealing (4.1, B1). | The premises shall be used as a sports pavilion including changing rooms, gym, ancillary lounge bar, cafT and crFche and for no other use within Class D2 of the Schedule of the Town and Country (Use Classes) Order 1987 without prior written permission of the local planning authority.  REASON:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable to the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the amenity of the locality (4.1, B1). | The area designated as a Gym/Exercise Area shall be used as a Gym/Exercise Area only and for no other use within Class D2 of the Schedule of the Town and Country (Use Classes) Order 1987 including as an overspill area for functions or as an extension to the lounge bar area without prior written permission of the local planning authority.  REASON:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the amenity of the locality (4.1, B1). | Details of a suitable means of locking the access to the car park hereby approved, shown on Drawing No. 3184-01B, shall be submitted to the local planning authority before work commences on the site. Such details as may be approved shall be installed before the first use of the development and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development. The access shall thereafter be kept locked to vehicles from no later than 30 minutes after the closing times permitted by Condition 16 of this permission and shall remain locked until the following opening time.         REASON: To ensure that the use of the car park is properly controlled in the interests of safety, visual amenity and the living conditions of nearby residents.   ( 4.4, 4.11, 3.1, 4.1, B1, B5, OL1, ES5, T63)
